title: Firefox won't save previous tabs IF another instance of Firefox is running including Private mode
content:
For example, say, you have 3 opened tabs in a Firefox (FF) windows. Normally, when you close FF and then re-open FF, it restores 3 previous opened tabs.

But, if you have another FF windows opened at the same time, when you close the FF windows with the 3 opened tabs and re-open back a new FF windows, FF won't restore the 3 opened tabs.

Same thing happens when you have another Private FF windows at the same time, when you close the non-Private FF with the 3 opened tabs, and then you re-open FF, it loses the 3 opened tabs.

That's why you can see 'countless' question about lost opened session, because of the issue above along with crash etc.

Is this a bug or a known feature?
creator: marhan91

title: errore
content:
ciao mi da sempre questo errore quando devo entrare nei siti con le smart card, Si è verificato un errore durante la connessione a apiauth.inail.it. Un modulo PKCS #11 ha restituito il valore CKR_GENERAL_ERROR: questo significa che si è verificato di un errore irreversibile.

Codice di errore: SEC_ERROR_PKCS11_GENERAL_ERROR
creator: studgoracci

title: Unable to delete older Mozilla version
content:
Windows 11 home computer with Mozilla Firefox version 122.0 from 1/23/2024 cannot be removed even in safe mode. When attempting to remove there are no errors, it just fails to go to next step when select uninstall. This version will result in a pop-up error of 'Couldn't load XPCOM.' A later version of Firefox worked with no issues. When the user accidently selects older version or at random times without user interaction the pop-up error appears.

Have not attempted to edit the registry.

Suggestions for steps to remove so a current version of Firefox can be installed would be appreciated

Thank you
creator: ash54

title: Firefox Nightly freezing
content:
Hi, I'm running with the latest nightly updates, but I had a problem with my bookmarks. I was getting hundreds of copies of some bookmarks, I ended up having to sign out of sync to allow me to clear them. I now cannot use nightly, every time I try to do anything, like open a new tab, or try to check if my bookmarks have been imported from another browser, which so far they have not, nor resynced from another PC, nightly freezes, and I have to close it. I had to manually reinstall my extensions as they did not resync either. Before doing that, I refreshed nightly, but that didn't seem to have any effect. I still have no bookmarks and a very hesitant browser.

I'm just about to check my other PC running Win 11 and nightly, hopefully that will behave.

title: new version 131.0.2
content:
I just installed the new Firefox version (131.0.2) and the installation gave me a new desktop lnk (the old one is still on the desktop). The new link (to an .exe file in "C:...\AppData\Local\Mozilla Firefox\browser") starts the new version of Firefox in its newborn virgin state, i.e., EVERYTHING from my previous version is missing.

The old link (which points to an identical .exe file in a completely different directory "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\browser" with same date stamp as the .exe file mentioned above) when executed results in an error message: Platform version '131.0' is not compatible with 

                                                                                              minVersion >= 131.0.2                                                                                               maxVersion <= 131.0.2

NOTE: The files in each of these two directories appears to be identical. I really want my old profile back.

HELP!
